page.title: 04DUNSTAFFNAGE CASTLE,CONNEL
page.content: Dunstaffnage Castle, built in the 13th century by the MacDougalls,is on a promontory jutting out into Loch Etive.In 1309 it was taken over by the Campbells.Inside the castle is a house dating back to 1725. The Captain of Dunstaffnage who lives in Dunstaffnage House is the heredit_ ary keeper of the castle.To retain his title he must spend one night each year in the castle. The stone stairway up to the gatehouse is about 100 years old.There used to be a drawbridge.Flora MacDonald was a prisoner in the castle.It is said that the Stone of Destiny lay here before being taken to Scone. To the south west of this ruined castle are the ruins of an ancient chapel beside which is the burial ground of the Campbells of Dunstaffnage.
